entry.title: Proposal: Pluggable Filter Framework
entry.summary: The discussion centers around the complexities and nuances of policies used in Bitcoin Core, particularly focusing on their purposes and how these differ from the general functions of mempools. It highlights a misunderstanding or oversimplification regarding the need for policy changes due to resource constraints. The conversation acknowledges that while anti-DOS measures within Bitcoin's framework may seem simple at first glance, they possess a depth that contributes significantly to the broader objective of decentralization. This underpins the argument that such security measures are essential, not just rudimentary steps but foundational elements that secure and sustain the decentralized nature of Bitcoin. Furthermore, it emphasizes the distinction between the strategic implementations aimed at enhancing Bitcoin's resilience against DOS attacks and the core philosophy guiding mempool's utility, suggesting that both play critical roles in preserving the network's decentralized ethos.
